page.title: 16THE A.T.C. IN BRECHIN
page.content: 2365 squadron is Brechin's branch of the Air Training Corps. There are 32 cadets, 2 sergeants and a flight sergeant. Leaders include two Warrant Officers and a Commanding Officer. The squadron meets every Tuesday and Thursday when time is spent practising for exams and drill competitions, taking part in map exercises, shooting on the rifle range or listening to talks by visitors. On Thursdays there are various classes such as aero - modelling, first aid and aircraft recognition.Outwith regular nights the squadron participates in an annual summer camp, Remembrance Day and trips to Europe. Recently members have begun to take part in the Duke of Edinburgh's Award Scheme. The squadron have the distinction of retaining the Scottish aircraft recognition trophy for the past 5 years.
